intro: Citrosma lepidota, commonly known as the rough-leaved citrosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain aromatic seeds. Citrosma lepidota is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
